item.title: Seasonal change in the microbiome of *Anopheles coluzzii*
item.description:
This is a project I took over once I got to the NIH looking at how the mosquito microbiome changes seasonally in areas of Mali either with permanent, year-round water, or in areas with no known water for ~7 months of the year. This work was done in hopes to better understand the dry season persistence mechanisms of Anopheles spp. mosquitoes, with hopes to move into understanding the impacts of this state on malaria transmission.

Look for future work with whole genome sequencing data!
